heading: Objective
body: Guide guests to a confident decision by clarifying what matters most, translating features into real-life outcomes, and leading a calm, trust-first Decision Point conversation before numbers.

heading: Hood Ornament Moment
body: The Decision Point is when the guest starts to feel ownership: 'this fits my life.' Our job is to make that moment clear, calm, and easy.
bullets: Recap priorities|Confirm fit|Build value|Ask micro-commitment|Clean next step
notes: Use as the module anchor framework.

heading: 2.0 The Science
body: Decision fatigue, fear of regret, and loss sensitivity increase at the decision stage. Clarity lowers cognitive load and builds confidence.

heading: Choice Overload
body: Too many options increases anxiety and delay. Limiting to 2–3 best-fit options restores clarity.

heading: Outcomes Beat Specs
body: Guests respond to outcomes more than features; translate specs into real-life benefits and feelings.

heading: Loss Aversion
body: Guests fear making a wrong decision; reduce perceived risk through calm language and clear next steps.
bullets: Normalize big decision|Reduce uncertainty|Clear next step
notes: Use in 'I need to think' handling.

heading: Micro-Commitments
body: Small yeses build momentum and confidence when done respectfully.
notes: Place in scripts as standard options.

heading: Decision Before Numbers
body: Before payments, the guest should understand why it fits and what value it creates.

heading: Use Their Words
body: Summarize priorities in the guest’s language to build trust and reduce confusion.

heading: Two-Layer Value
body: Every key point includes feature→outcome and outcome→feeling.

heading: Clean Numbers Transition
body: Numbers are a service step, not a confrontation. Use permission-based language.
bullets: Would it be helpful if…|Keep it simple|Stay calm

heading: 15-Second Recap
body: A short recap of top priorities and why they matter, in the guest’s words.

heading: 3-Sentence Value Stack
body: Fit reason + daily outcome + concern solved.
bullets: Why it fits|What they'll feel|What it solves

heading: Decision Point Questions
body: Three respectful micro-commitment options to maintain momentum without pressure.

heading: I Need to Think
body: Validate, isolate uncertainty with one question, then simplify the next step.

heading: Role-Play Focus
body: Practice recaps, value stacks, micro-commitments, and clean transitions under uncertainty.

heading: Worksheet Purpose
body: Reinforce Decision Point clarity: priorities, value stack, decision question, and clean transition language.
